text: Particle size, also called grain size, means the diameter of individual grains of sediment, or the lithified particles in clastic rocks. The term may also be used for other granular materials.Size ranges define limits of classes that are given names in the Wentworth scale (or Udden-Wentworth) used in the United States. The Krumbein phi (φ) scale, a modification of the Wentworth scale created by W. C. Krumbein, (Krumbein & Sloss 1963) is a logarithmic scale computed by the equation: :\phi=-\log_2{D/Do}\, where :\phi is the Krumbein phi scale, and :D is the diameter of the particle :Do is a reference diameter, equal to 1 mm (to make the equation dimensionally consistent.)
